channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Landscaped beds being used as a drinking area, 31st August
item.description:
Recently there has been a gathering of men drinking cans of beer at this particular spot near lea bridge roundabout. they then leave empty cans of beer on the ground littering the landscaped beds despite there being a bin a short distance away. Not ideal and also the gatherings perhaps indimitating for passers by especially in the evening.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Clapton Road, Clapton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discarded sofa, 31st August
item.description:
A black plastic/leather sofa has been left outside 33/35 Ballina Street for weeks, since mid August. Please can you remove it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ballina Street, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti inciting racism, 31st August
item.description:
Looks like kids have graffitied the white wall below the old NatWest building by Asda car park. It's offensive to many of us and at the same time incites and conveys racism. It's been there too long already and needs to be removed quickly. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, High Firs, Swanley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bucket containing foul smelling water and rotting food waste, 31st August
item.description:
Just outside the wall of the house number 36 on the pavement facing the road, someone left a bucket with foul smelling water and rotting food waste in there. Potentially could have hazardous chemicals in the water. Apparently been present for over a week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Seacourt Road, London

item.title: Fly tipping, 31st August
item.description:
Someone is repeatedly fly tipping in our street. Weâ€™ve cleared this once and it just invited them to come back and dump more filthy, damp, mouldy kids toys on the corner. Iâ€™d like for our street cleaning staff or refuse collection staff to remove this, and someone from the council to install a notice advising no fly-tipping. In parallel, I will pursue L&Q to put plants or something there to dissuade additional tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Carnecke Gardens, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet
